title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Thursday 6 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: a senior coroner is calling for a review of junction 14 of the m1 following a pile-up which killed a car driver last week .
thames valley police , who cover buckinghamshire , has said it is investigating information the force has received regarding former prime minister sir edward heath .
a bedfordshire council say they are prepared to work with a man who will be told to demolish part of his house after defying planning regulations .
a new housing estate in luton , being built next to the m1 , is being criticised by neighbouring residents who say their privacy has been lost .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: goodnight all
text: that 's all from the local live team for beds , herts and bucks today .
we 'll be back with all the latest news , sport , weather , travel and hopefully more cake from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you missed us today , here 's a round-up of the top stories :

documents.title: great british bake off : 'i 've got the taste for it '
text: a `` contemporary '' and `` superb '' black forest gateaux from luton-born nadiya ( centre ) has secured her a second week in the
she said : `` i live to fight another week , yay !
i 've got the taste for it now and i want to keep going . ''
in other bake off news - ladbrokes has halted betting on the show after a flurry of wagers sparked fears the
author: Martin Barber
BBC News Online

documents.title: watford : multilingual squad an advantage
text: watford will benefit from the club 's
the premier league newcomers have made 10 summer signings from seven countries and their squad contains 22 different nationalities .
`` i think it is an advantage for us because when you are training more english players maybe it is difficult to change , '' said the spaniard before their premier league opener at everton .
`` now i can change habits very easily . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: m1 j14 : highways england 'will support review '
text: highways england say they `` will support any review the coroner requests '' , after a pile-up killed a woman in her 30s at j14 of the m1 last week .
ayse yalcinkaya , from bedfordshire , was in traffic waiting to leave the motorway when a lorry crashed into the back of her car .

`` safety is a top priority for highways england and we keep safety on our network continually under review it would be inappropriate to speculate on the cause of the incident at this stage due to the ongoing police investigation , '' highways england said .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: a dry night and sunny start to friday
text: staying mainly dry overnight with skies clearing and a few mist patches forming later .
a light west to north-westerly breeze and turning chilly with temperatures falling to 7c ( 45f ) in rural spots .
friday will be a largely fine , dry day with sunny spells - but cloud amounts increasing through the day .
feeling pleasantly warm with light and variable winds , temperatures reaching up to 23c ( 73f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: great british bake off : nadiya 's 'superb ' black forest gateaux
text: it 's was a triumphant trip back to the '70s in last night 's bake off when
her retro cake with a contemporary twist helped her sail through to the second round of the cookery show ,
paul hollywood said the cake was `` melt in the mouth '' with a `` nice sharpness of fresh cherry '' , with mary berry enthusing it was `` very different , very good and absolutely superb '' .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News Online

documents.title: kharine named stevenage keeper coach
text: former chelsea and celtic player
the 46-year-old was most recently a goalkeeper coach at national league south side hemel hempstead town .
the ex-russia international made 146 appearances for chelsea , winning an fa cup runners-up medal in 1994 .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

text: the top stories we 're looking at this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: babies saved after being locked in car
text: two babies who were accidentally locked in a car outside a shopping centre in milton keynes , have been released by firefighters today .
the fire service attended the scene outside the centre : mk just after 11:20 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: breakingedward heath : thames valley police investigating
text: thames valley police , who cover buckinghamshire , has said it is
several other police forces are investigating claims of historical child sexual abuse involving the former prime minister .
sir edward , who was conservative prime minister from 1970 to 1974 , died aged 89 in 2005 at his home in salisbury .

documents.title: travel update : roads and rail delays
text: roads are looking rather busy across the three counties this afternoon .
check your journey
at j16 of the m25 anticlockwise in buckinghamshire there is slow traffic through to j12 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: m1 j14 : lorry driver says there 's double the traffic it 's designed for
text: a senior coroner is calling for a review of the milton keynes junction of the m1 following a pile-up which killed a car driver last week .
the 35-year-old woman from elstow in bedfordshire was sitting in traffic when a lorry crashed into the back of her car - she was pronounced dead at the scene .

dunstable lorry driver david footitt witnessed another pile up the junction and says it was originally designed to handle less traffic : `` we 've got four lanes leading up from luton and then literally , as you 're getting off the motorway , the right hand lane is controlled by traffic signals onto the roundabout and the left lane is with flow '' .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man wanted in connection with high wycombe stabbing
text: police in the thames valley are trying to trace a 19-year-old teenager in connection with a stabbing in high wycombe .
a 24-year-old man was stabbed in the back and side during the incident , which happened in the early hours of the morning in mendip way near the junction with the pastures service road on 16 july .
hamza hussain is described as asian , about 6ft 2ins , slim , with brown hair .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: main jailed after stealing nearly £ 4k from ticket machines
text: a man has been jailed for 10 months after stealing about
author: Get Bucks

documents.title: pfizer and flynn pharma accused of overcharging by cma
text: pharmaceutical firms pfizer and hertfordshire-based flynn pharma have been
pfizer and flynn can now supply their own views and evidence before the competition and markets authority ( cma ) said .
`` ensuring a sustainable supply of our products to uk patients is of paramount importance to pfizer and was at the heart of our decision to divest the product , '' said pfizer in a statement .
`` pfizer is co-operating fully with the cma 's ongoing investigation . ''
a message left with flynn pharma was not immediately returned .
author: BBC News
UK

author: Jane Killick

documents.title: st albans cathedral launches fund-raising project
text: st albans cathedral has started a new project to raise money for the upkeep of the historic building .
the project
all money raised will be put into transforming the building which stands over the place where alban , britain 's first saint , was buried more than 1700 years ago , for generations to come .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: new housing estate in luton : your reaction
text: the discussion about a new housing estate in luton , which has been criticised by neighbours for invading upon their privacy and causing general disturbance and dirt , continues on our
michael
lesley , a fellow neighbour ,
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: herts drugs company accused of overcharging
text: a hertfordshire-based drug company is being accused ramping up the cost of an epilepsy treatment .
flynn pharma , which is based in stevenage , is being investigated alongside american company pfizer over claims they illegally over-charged the nhs for the drug .
the
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: penn school : search for buyer ongoing
text: efforts to secure a buyer for specialist penn school in buckinghamshire continues , despite 71 members of staff receiving redundancy notices today .
administrator delloitte says that the aim of rescuing penn school is an ongoing concern but they had to let the majority of staff go as there is no more money coming in .

`` our priority remains the welfare of this vulnerable group of children and we are working as hard as possible to secure the best outcome for the school '' , said lee manning , a joint administrator for the school .
`` we are still holding discussions with a number of interested parties to buy the school '' .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: thames valley police chief constable in budget cut warning
text: the public could have to deal with `` low level incidents '' following potential police budget cuts , the chief constable of
francis habgood expressed concern over reductions to the government grant to police forces , following mooted public sector cuts of up to 40 % .
he pointed to success in dealing with rural crime through landowners carrying out their own patrols .
the chief constable insisted such measures were `` not vigilantism '' .
author: BBC News
UK

documents.title: penn school : teachers handed redundancy notices
text: more than 70 members of staff at penn school in buckinghamshire have been handed redundancy notices today .
parents have been fighting the closure of the special school , which went into administration about a month ago after running out of money .
administrator deloitte says that , with no more funds available , it can not continue to pay teachers ' salaries , but that a few members of staff are being kept on to maintain the site .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton housing development : your comments
text: you 've been having your say on
nic
helen
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: sunny spells forecast this afternoon
text: it will be a much brighter afternoon compared to the morning , with sunny spells developing quite widely .
it will feel warm in the sunshine , with the highest temperature of 23c ( 73f ) towards st albans .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: two jailed for terrorising shopkeepers
text: two men who terrorised shopkeepers in a string of armed robberies in the luton and dunstable area have been jailed .

scott cerqua ( right ) , 36 , of hitchin road in luton and george mcaward , 32 , from the mall in dunstable would enter the shops , threaten staff , often holding them at knife-point , and steal large quantities of cash , alcohol and cigarettes .
they struck 10 times in the space of two weeks .
on one sunday in march , they robbed four local convenience stores in dunstable , slip end , luton and kensworth .
cerqua was jailed for 10 years and mcaward for nine years and nine months at luton crown court .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: busy roads in bucks
text: the a412 southlands road in iver heath , buckinghamshire .
is closed in both directions at the junction with sevenhills road due to an accident involving four vans .
there 's heavy traffic on the m25 clockwise between j24-j25 because of a broken down lorry which has closed one lane .
on the a355 beaconsfield road there are delays both ways in farnham common through the roadworks .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: boreham wood sign former dartford striker
text: national league side boreham wood have signed former dartford and barnet striker harry crawford on a
the 23-year-old left the darts at the end of last season after scoring seven goals in 40 appearances .
crawford is wood 's seventh signing since promotion to the national league .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: airport warns of tube strikes
text: london luton airport
london underground strike all day today .
please check your travel plans and allow plenty of time for your journey .

documents.title: council prepared to work with barton-le-clay home-owner
text: a bedfordshire council say they are prepared to work with a man who will be told to demolish part of his house , after defying planning regulations and turning his bungalow into a three-storey mansion .
syed raza shah , whose home overlooks the a6 in barton le clay , has lost the latest stage of the

central beds councillor nigel young told bbc three counties radio mr shah may decide to appeal again : `` we would work with mr shah if he was able to submit an application which was acceptable within the law and which meant the minimum destruction or demolition of the house . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: £ 15.6m dunstable leisure centre plans approved
text: plans for the £ 15.6m redevelopment of dunstable leisure centre have been approved by central bedfordshire council .
the entire redevelopment is needed as the current leisure facilities are not fit for purpose , and repairs would simply be a short-term fix , say the council .
a building contractor will now be employed to design and build the new centre , to be opened by the end of 2017 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: slow traffic on m25
text: the m25 is moving slow clockwise between j24-j25 due to a lane closure after a lorry broke down .
anticlockwise on the m25 there is heavy traffic between j17-j16 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: residents concerns must account for 'life-changing ' new homes
text: residents in luton say a new housing development has ruined their privacy and created a `` m1 for rats '' .
the new houses behind butely road were built on open land previously considered too close to the m1 to be habitable , but the dire housing crisis in the town led the council to reconsider .
they gave the green light for development in 2012 .

catalyst housing , the company behind the estate , said in a statement that while they do sympathise , they say resident 's `` concerns must be balanced against the life-changing opportunities that this new affordable housing is bringing to their town . ''
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: council responds to criticism over new luton homes
text: the councillor in charge of housing for luton borough council has responded to
neighbouring residents say their privacy has been lost as the new houses overlook their properties .
the land in butely road had previously been considered too close to the motorway to develop .
`` it 's a matter of need '' , said labour councillor tom shaw .

`` you would n't do it if you had a perfect world , which some people seem to think they should have , what you 'd do is built detached properties , four-bedroom , no one looking into each other - but we have n't got that luxury in luton . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hit and run boy 'very brave ' says mum
text: police in milton keynes are searching for a motorcyclist who left a 12-year-old boy seriously injured after a hit and run .
the youngster suffered serious leg injuries after being hit by the off-road bike on a grass playing area in lammas , beanhill , about 15:45 on tuesday .
`` he had a big gash to his leg , you could see right down to his bone , '' michael 's mother laura told us .
`` the nurses were brilliant , the surgeons were brilliant .
he will just have a scar and he 'll need to go back to the gp to get the stitches removed . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man loses life savings in computer scam
text: a hertfordshire man in his 60s has lost his life savings after a computer scam carried out over the phone .
the man from hatfield was targeted on 29 july when he received several calls from someone claiming to be from microsoft , who talked him through a number of processes to supposedly fix the machine .
he was then told to provide payment by using his online banking device .
it was only after the calls the man checked his bank account and realised his life savings had been stolen .
police want to hear from anyone else who feel they may have been targeted .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: watford boss quique flores aces first premier league press conference
text: jose mourinho has real competition this season : watford boss quique flores is seriously cool .
his first premier league press conference is done and dusted .
he was calm , confident and assured despite survival being the major talking point in the room .
relaxed and happy , with perhaps a touch of tiredness , flores was comfortable with every question and respectful of saturday 's opponents everton .
it was a solid opening performance , hear match commentary on
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: flores 's first premier league press conference
text: sopwell house in st albans , described as a chic , elegant georgian mansion , is the setting this morning for quique flores 's first premier league press conference ahead of the new season .
it 's a hotel used by many football teams including england ahead of internationals .

on the agenda this morning no doubt : signings ( i believe there will be more to come to add to the 10 so far ) , survival ( will the ambition be more than just staying up ) and everton ( does he expect john stones to feature ?
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: all change here
text: good morning all - thank you to nic for looking after things this morning and keeping us up-to-date with all the latest news .
i 'll be with you for the rest of the day .
we 'll have more on the owner of the house in barton-le-clay who has been served with an enforcement notice after extending the property by 165 % .
if you 'd like to get in contact at all , please do .
you can

Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: morning travel update
text: there 's a lane closed on the slip road from toddington services on the m1 southbound because of a broken down coach .
roads are
if you 're heading into london today , be aware that all tube services are suspended
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: spate of buckinghamshire cycle thefts
text: british transport police ( btp ) is appealing for the public 's help in identifying a man from cctv following a series of cycle thefts from chesham underground station .
three bikes , with a combined value of £ 1,800 , have been stolen and officers are treating the thefts as linked .
btp have released cctv images of a hooded man they want to speak to .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News, East

documents.title: mk dons players becomes coach
text: football team milton keynes dons announce that keith andrews has retired as a player to become first-team coach at stadium mk .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: m1 safety call after death
text: a coroner is calling for a review of safety at j14 of the m1 at milton keynes following the death of a bedford woman on the exit slip road last week .
ayse yalcinkaya , 35 , of elstow , was waiting in stationary traffic to leave the motorway , when a lorry crashed into the back of her car .
it caused a five vehicle pile up and mrs yalcinkaya was pronounced dead at the scene .
speaking ahead of a full inquest into her death to be held next year , senior coroner tom osborne said he wants a full investigation into queueing at that junction on the m1 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News, East

documents.title: new estate development criticised
text: a new housing estate in luton , being built next to the m1 , is
the land at butely road is being developed despite previously being considered too close to the motorway .
this land was prevented from development in the 1970s because it was too close to the m1 , but a housing crisis in luton led to the council changing its position .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: tube strike : commuters to expect long delays
text: if you 're travelling down to the capital from the three counties today then it 's likely you 'll have some long queues and delays in store due to the strike that has shut down the tube network .
about 250 extra buses have been laid on , but there are fears of potential gridlock if commuters switch to cars .
the 24-hour strike by four unions began on wednesday evening and there will be no tube service until friday .
our team at bbc london live
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News, East

documents.title: weather : dry and bright later
text: it will be rather cloudy first thing with perhaps the odd spot of rain or drizzle , but the cloud will break up later in the morning with sunny spells developing by the afternoon .
it will feel warm in the sunshine with the highest temperatures towards milton keynes reaching a maximum 22c ( 72f ) .
after a fine evening tonight will be dry with light winds and clear skies .
it will be a cooler night than of late with the odd mist patch possible .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: boy seriously hurt in playing area hit and run
text: a 12-year-old boy has been seriously injured after being hit by an off-road motorbike being ridden on a grass playing area in milton keynes .
the boy suffered serious leg injuries at the playing area off lammas in beanhill at around 15:45 on tuesday .
the motorcyclist rode off and police are appealing for witnesses .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome
text: good morning and welcome to local live for bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire .
we 'll bring you the latest news , travel , sport and weather updates for the three counties throughout the day until 18:00 .
if there 's anything we 're not mentioning that you think we should know about , then drop us an
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News, East
